article_title: Kasich Star Wars ad: 'Only hope' to stop Clinton
article_text:
John Kasich is calling himself the "only hope" to stop Hillary Clinton in a new Star Wars Day-themed ad.

The 90-second advertisement paints a picture of the year 2017, as yellow text mimics the opening crawl of the "Star Wars" movies.

In this not-so-distant future, Clinton has just defeated Donald Trump "in the largest landslide since Reagan in 1984."

Also in this future, Nancy Pelosi is the speaker of the House planning new tax hikes and Chuck Schumer leads a Democratic Senate majority.

Stay abreast of the latest developments from nation's capital and beyond with curated News Alerts from the Washington Examiner news desk and delivered to your inbox.

article_metadata.description:
John Kasich is calling himself the only hope to stop Hillary Clinton in a new Star Wars Day-themed ad.
The 90-second advertisement paints a picture of the year 2017, as yellow text mimics the opening crawl of the Star Wars movies.
In this not-so-distant future, Clinton has just defeated Donald Trump in the largest landslide since Reagan in 1984.
Also in this future, Nancy Pelosi is the speaker of the House planning new tax hikes and Chuck Schumer leads a Democratic Senate majority.
New executive orders restricting the 2nd amendment are being drafted, while increased federal spending on Obamacare is readied, text reads. But we have hope it can be different ...
The ad then cuts to clips of a news anchors noting Kasich's high favorability and good odds against Clinton in a general election.
Only one candidate can defeat Hillary Clinton in the fall, a caption reads, before cutting to Kasich's logo.
